meanings.definition: To bring into agreement or accord.
meanings.sent1: The group worked together to harmonise their ideas for the project.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had to harmonise their schedules to spend more time together.
meanings.sent3: The cats and dogs in the neighborhood seemed to harmonise their barking and meowing in a strange symphony.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the painting harmonised perfectly, creating a beautiful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The chef used various spices to harmonise the flavors in the dish, creating a delicious blend.

meanings.definition: To sing or play in harmony.
meanings.sent1: The choir members harmonised beautifully during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The band members practiced for hours to harmonise their instruments perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to harmonise with the music playing softly in the background.
meanings.sent4: The waves of the ocean harmonised with the gentle breeze, creating a peaceful melody.
meanings.sent5: The singers harmonised their voices, creating a magical and enchanting sound.

meanings.definition: To combine or blend in a pleasing way.
meanings.sent1: The flavors in the dish harmonised perfectly, creating a delicious taste.
meanings.sent2: The different scents in the room harmonised to create a calming atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The colors of the sunset harmonised with the sky, painting a beautiful evening.
meanings.sent4: The various instruments harmonised together, creating a symphony of sound.
meanings.sent5: The ingredients in the recipe harmonised to create a mouthwatering dish.
